Error Logs

The Error Logs section records technical issues that occur while Unit Master is running, helping administrators and support teams diagnose and fix problems.

What are Error Logs?

Error Logs are a technical record of failures or unexpected behaviour in the system. Whenever Unit Master encounters an error, information about the problem is written to the log so that it can be reviewed later.

These logs are mainly used by system administrators and developers to understand what went wrong, reproduce the issue if needed, and apply a fix to improve system stability.

View Error Logs

Error Logs capture technical issues that occur while the system is running. When the system fails or encounters an error, information is saved in the database or a log file.

These logs typically store:

  • Error type and message A short description of what went wrong.
  • Date and time When the error occurred.
  • Technical details Extra information to help developers diagnose the issue.

Administrators and support teams use error logs to troubleshoot problems and improve stability. In many cases, reviewing the log is the first step when a user reports that “something is not working”.
